intro: Cissampelos pareira var. haenkeana, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are often consumed by birds and mammals. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
